summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 12914, entitled "An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Harvard Avenue North, in the City of Seattle, by grading, and by constructing concrete sidewalks on that portion of Harvard Avenue North between Roanoke Street and Miller Street, and by constructing concrete sidewalks on that portion of said Harvard Avenue North between Miller Street and East Lynn Street, and by constructing necessary curbs, gutters and crosswalks throughout the entire length of the improvement, in accordance with Majority Petition, being File No. 28498 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said City, approved December 6, 1899.
